B C D F G H I K L M N O P R S T V W X Y

B

Boat - Class in p
This is the boat with the net what we can move to catch fishes.
Stores a reference to the water surface for asking the drifting velocity and to determine the y coordinate of the boat (it depends (equals to) the water level at the position of the boat).
The boat is a MovingObject with some restrictions: The boat can move only horizontally, the water level determines its y coordinate.
Boat(WaterSurface) - Constructor for class p.Boat
Creates a new boat.

Boat of the game.

Color of the boat (wihtout the net).

The height of the boat.

Polygon of the boat.
BOAT_WIDTH - Static variable in class p.Boat
The width of the boat.
Bubble - Class in p
Class representing a bubble in the water.
The bubbles are simply light circles.

Vector of the bubbles.

Fishing - Class in p
Main class of Fishing.

This program has been created for the event of the Java technology turns 10!.

This is the controller layer of Fishing in the MVC architecture.

MovingObject - Class in p
Represents an object which is positioned in plane and can move in both x and y direction.
Position is determined by x and y coordiantes.
The coordinates and the components of velocity are in double precision.
The position is visible in int precision, in all cases it is enough, and where we use the position outside of the class needed as int too!
MovingObject(double, double, double, double) - Constructor for class p.MovingObject
Creates a new MovingObject.

waterSurface - Variable in class p.GameModel
The water surface of the 'sea'.
WaterSurface - Class in p
This class simulates the water surface which is basically a sin function.
The surface function is:
Amplitude*sin(phi+omega*x)
WaterSurface() - Constructor for class p.WaterSurface
WaterSurface creates a new WaterSurface.

X

x - Variable in class p.MovingObject
x coordinate of the object.

Y

y - Variable in class p.MovingObject
y coordinate of the object.
